rule_name: High Number of Egress Network Connections from Unusual Executable
logic: Detects high number of egress network connections from unusual executables indicating C2 or malware activity
Detects unusual base64 encoding/decoding activity used to obfuscate malicious data

rule_name: Potential Port Scanning Activity from Compromised Host
logic: Detects port scanning activity from compromised hosts for reconnaissance

rule_name: Potential Subnet Scanning Activity from Compromised Host
logic: Detects subnet scanning to identify live hosts within network ranges
Monitors for code execution attempts within PostgreSQL environment via shell commands
Detects execution of file transfer utilities that may be used for data exfiltration

rule_name: Potential Malware-Driven SSH Brute Force Attempt
logic: Identifies malware-driven SSH brute force attacks from compromised Linux hosts

rule_name: Unusual Process Spawned from Web Server Parent
logic: Detects unusual processes spawned from web servers indicating potential webshells

rule_name: Unusual Command Execution from Web Server Parent
logic: Detects command execution from web server processes for persistence or C2

rule_name: UID Elevation from Previously Unknown Executable
logic: Monitors for privilege escalation to root via unknown executables
Detects modifications to /etc/hosts file indicating potential DNS poisoning or host redirection attacks
Detects processes executing commands that modify the hosts file for malicious purposes
